pullRequest.body:
This provides some results and constructions for adjunctions between functors on preadditive categories:
* If one of the adjoint functors is additive, so is the other.
* If one of the adjoint functors is additive, the equivalence `Adjunction.homEquiv` lifts to
an additive equivalence `Adjunction.homAddEquivOfLeftAdjoint` resp.
`Adjunction.homAddEquivOfRightAdjoint`.
* We also give a version of this additive equivalence as an isomorphism of `preadditiveYoneda`
functors (analogous to `Adjunction.compYonedaIso`), in
`Adjunction.compPreadditiveYonedaIsoOfLeftAdjoint` resp.
`Adjunction.compPreadditiveYonedaIsoOfRightAdjoint`.

---

GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

### PR summary [f8589df971](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/20083/commits/f8589df97161aeeaf28c413fc9a8163c389a34ab)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Adjunction.Additive` (new file)|808|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ compPreadditiveYonedaIsoOfLeftAdjoint`
`+ homAddEquiv`
`+ homAddEquiv_add`
`+ homAddEquiv_neg`
`+ homAddEquiv_sub`
`+ homAddEquiv_symm_add`
`+ homAddEquiv_symm_neg`
`+ homAddEquiv_symm_sub`
`+ homAddEquiv_symm_zero`
`+ homAddEquiv_zero`
`+ left_adjoint_additive`
`+ right_adjoint_additive`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>Increase in tech debt: (relative, absolute) = (1.00, 0.00)</summary>

|Current number|Change|Type|
|-:|:-:|:-|
|1515|1|erw|

Current commit [f8589df971](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/f8589df97161aeeaf28c413fc9a8163c389a34ab)
Reference commit [5f24fc48e5](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/5f24fc48e5bbc2aa88d21ccd4c2ed932b9b11483)

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

Once the lemmas `left/right_adjoint_additive` have been obtained, I think we may define only one `Adjunction.homAddEquiv` (assuming `F.Additive`). I would think we should declare it with `@[simps!]` (without `.lemmasOnly`), and add `homEquiv_add/sub/neg/zero`, `homEquiv_symm_add/...` simp lemmas.
Done. The `homEquiv_symm` lemmas can all be proved by `simp`, so the linter might ask to remove them.

Well, the linter is complaining about all the lemmas you requested: the `homAddEquiv_add` etc lemmas are not in `simp` normal form (would they be that useful if I put them in `simp` normal form, I'm not sure), and the `homAddEquiv_symm_add` etc lemmas can all be proved by `simp`...

I checked and the automatically generated `homAddEquiv_apply` (and its `symm` version) are also not great. For example, `homAddEquiv_apply` proves that `(adj.homAddEquiv X Y) f = adj.unit.app X  G.map f`, which seems like a bad idea since I had a lot of trouble with the similar lemma `homEquiv_apply` before someone had the great idea to remove its `@[simp]` attribute. 
I would want `homAddEquiv_apply` to just say that `adj.homAddEquiv X Y f = adj.homEquiv X Y f`, and I'm going to change it now to do that.

pullRequest.title: feat(CategoryTheory/Adjunction/Additive): adjunctions between additive functors
